reporting-org.narrative: Environmental Centre for Oil Spills and Gas Flaring (NACGOND)

title.narrative: Conduct quarterly visits to the schools/clubs to assess performance and impact of club members' activities on their peers.

description.narrative: Implementing partners visited in teams to various schools and carried out sensitization of students to sustain the tempo gained during previous engagements. As such, issues such as club objectives and action plans were reviewed in line with current realities. Among other things that came up during discussions were issues of club sustainability, continuous environmental awareness and campaign in other schools to escalate the knowledge and commemoration of World Environment Day as well as preparation for the 2019 essay and quiz competitions.

owner-org.narrative: This activity was implemented at several dates by many implementing partners across the Niger Delta States.

activity-date.narrative: Activity started on planned dates across many schools and states in the Niger Delta.

organisation.narrative: All project inquiries are directed to the National Coordinator who is the Project Coordinator.

recipient-country.narrative: This activity was implemented by several implementing partners in Akwa Ibom, Cross River, Abia, Rivers, Bayelsa and Delta States.

sector.narrative: Environmental education targeting the youths in secondary schools was was basically carried out with the aim of forming their minds to have interest in protecting the environment when they grow up to become captains of industries, politicians and the like. The long term impact will ensure that, collective actions of these youths will ensure reduction in the level of pollution in the Niger Delta.

condition.narrative: There is increase in the number of youths in schools equipped with environmental awareness in target schools across the Niger Delta who independently campaign against environmental pollution in the region.

title.narrative: Increasing number of youths in targeted schools have undergone environmental awareness training of NACGOND in the Niger Delta and are undertaking independent campaigns against environmental pollution in the region.

description.narrative: There is significant rise in the number of students independently carrying out environmental awareness campaigns and advocacy across many communities in the Niger Delta where this project is being implemented.

title.narrative: There is evidence of increasing number of youths in targeted schools who have undergone environmental awareness training of NACGOND in the Niger Delta undertaking independent campaigns and advocacy against environmental pollution in region.
